place.name: HAROLDSTON ST ISSELL
place.gazetteerText: HARROLDSTON-ST. ISSELLS, a parish in Haverfordwest district, Pembroke; on the river Cleddy, 1 mile SE of Haverfordwest town and r. station. Post town, Haverfordwest. Acres, 1, 150. Real property, £2, 050. Pop., 281. Houses, 59. The old seat of the Harrolds and the Perrots here is now a ruin. Fern Hill is the chief residence. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of St. David's. Value, £56. Patron, James Higgon, Esq. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
